metadata.title: CVE-2023-22997 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.1.2, kernel/module/decompress.c misinterpretsthe module_get_next_page return value (expects it to be NULL in the errorcase, whereas it is actually an error pointer).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-22997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-40-generic - 5.19.0-40.41~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-40-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-40.41~22.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-40-generic-64k - 5.19.0-40.41~22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-19.19').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-40.41~22.04.1').
linux-kvm package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-1004.4').
